statements.statement: I perceive integrations into Slack, HipChat or similar as valuable for receiving status notifications and updates from third-party systems within channels (e.g., Jira, Git, InVision, Twitter).
I perceive integrations into Slack, HipChat or similar as valuable for receiving real-time information from third-party systems within channels (e.g., critical errors, criticial user actions).

I perceive integrations into Slack, HipChat or similar as valuable for receiving aggregated information from third-party systems within channels (e.g., lunch menus of nearby cafeterias, generating meeting agenda).

I perceive integrations into Slack, HipChat or similar as valuable for receiving metrics and key performance indicators from third-party systems within channels (e.g., velocities of scrum teams, stats about app reviews/ratings).
I perceive integrations into Slack, HipChat or similar as valuable for setting and getting reminders within channels (e.g., reminder to clean the office or run a daily standup).

I perceive integrations into Slack, HipChat or similar as valuable for setting and getting nudges/ triggers to action within channels (e.g., trigger employees to track working hours or fix unresolved issues).

I perceive integrations into Slack, HipChat or similar as valuable for setting and getting nudges/ triggers to action and possibilities to resolve it within the channel (e.g., a message with buttons for employees to track working hours).
I perceive integrations into Slack, HipChat or similar as valuable for capturing data in third-party systems from within channels (e.g., adding cards to Trello or Wunderlist).
I perceive integrations into Slack, HipChat or similar as valuable for querying information from third-party systems within channels (e.g., query current sales, search on stackoverflow).

I perceive integrations into Slack, HipChat or similar as valuable for invoking functions from third-party systems and make this invocation visible within channels (e.g., starting deployments, creating video conferences, asking questions on stackoverflow).

I perceive integrations into Slack, HipChat or similar as valuable for adding gatekeepers that validate access to functions of third-party systems (e.g., ensuring four-eyes principle, requesting permission to deploy to production environment).
I perceive integrations into Slack, HipChat or similar as valuable for having messages processed and enriched with additional information (e.g., enriching customer name with data from Salesforce).
I perceive integrations into Slack, HipChat or similar as valuable for having messages processed and replaced (e.g., posting giphy or translated message).
I perceive integrations into Slack, HipChat or similar as valuable for having messages processed and visually enriched with user interface elements (e.g., enriching poll with buttons and statistics).

I perceive the value of Slack, HipChat or similar messenger integrations as limited, since my company constraints the usage of such messengers.
I perceive the value of Slack, HipChat or similar messenger integrations as limited, since most of my work is not digital.

I perceive Slack apps and integrations with third-party systems as constraining, since I use these systems in my everyday work.
I perceive Slack, HipChat or similar messenger integrations as constraining, since the presented information lacks graphical and visual richness.
I perceive Slack, HipChat or similar messenger integrations as constraining, since they introduce process-orientation and reduce my autonomy.
I perceive Slack, HipChat or similar messenger integrations as constraining, since information is concealed after I sent the message (e.g., my individual values disappear, user identify is removed).
I perceive Slack, HipChat or similar messenger integrations as constraining, since I can achieve the same results with dedicated tools.

I perceive Slack, HipChat or similar messenger integrations as constraining due to a lack of rich user interface elements for entering data (e.g., it is annoying to pass numerous parameters with commands).
I perceive Slack, HipChat or similar messenger integrations as constraining due to a lack of configuration possibilities without programming customized integrations.
I perceive the value of Slack, HipChat or similar messenger integrations as limited, since it is difficult to know how to use them.
